It sounds great Dawn. . . and I think what you do is very important work. . .
helping women to see they do have choices. It sounds like what your focus is
fits so well in with unschooling. Do you have the opportunity to turn people
on to unschooling/homeschooling with what you do?

lovemary

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Making Changes in Lifestyles
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 9/8/01 7:39:46 PM US Mountain Standard Time, ... I haven t read any Sylvia Brown but I do know who she is and about the work she does.
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 9/8/01 7:39:46 PM US Mountain Standard Time,
lite2yu@... writes:


> I just went to your website. . . very cool! Have you read any of Sylvia
> Browne's work? Some of what you talk about sounds like her cell regression
> stuff, which I find particularly fascinating.

I haven't read any Sylvia Brown but I do know who she is and about the work
she does. Looking at the Pluto, North and South Nodes in your Natal chart is
really helpful is finding your Soul Purpose and how to get there. I
absolutely love what I do and working with women (especially mothers) to help
them find a career they can do from home around their children and make money
at it, has been one of my main goals in the past couple of years. I'm
working on a book about this and will let you know when it's finished.

Again thanks for the feedback.

Dawn

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Making Changes in Lifestyles
messages.msgSnippet: Thanks Dawn, I just went to your website. . . very cool! Have you read any of Sylvia Browne s work? Some of what you talk about sounds like her cell regression
messages.messageBody:
Thanks Dawn,

I just went to your website. . . very cool! Have you read any of Sylvia
Browne's work? Some of what you talk about sounds like her cell regression
stuff, which I find particularly fascinating. My daughter and I are going to
do some of the meditations on this and try to recover some past life
information. . . I was so excited when Lelia (my 12 year old) picked up one
of the books I had laying around and read it (no prompting at all from me)
and is so interested in it as well. . . and my husband too. Should be really
interesting.

lovemary


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Making Changes in Lifestyles
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 9/8/2001 9:59:50 AM Eastern Daylight Time, ... Well, it s a business idea I have been kicking around for a year or so, and it looks like the
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 9/8/2001 9:59:50 AM Eastern Daylight Time,
NumoAstro@... writes:


> Good luck with your venture. By the way, what is it? Tell everyone what
> you
>

Well, it's a business idea I have been kicking around for a year or so, and
it looks like the time is come to do it (sometime next year). It's a barter
exchange, where we sign up other business's that are interested in bartering
with other business's. It frees up their cash and allows them to move extra
inventory they may have. I was in one in Louisiana and absolutely loved it. .
. it's a great way to expand your business and increase your bottom line. My
husband is a travel agent and would still do that, although only as an
outside agent. We moved here for him to take over the travel agency from his
uncle, but it doesn't look like that may happen. I think it's a great
opportunity for him to be the primary parent at home, even though it will be
a home business and I will be home a lot.

lovemary


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]

messages.subject: Making Changes in Lifestyles
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 9/8/01 6:52:07 AM US Mountain Standard Time, ... Good luck with your new business.... Ultimately Steve will have his own business where he
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 9/8/01 6:52:07 AM US Mountain Standard Time,
Unschooling-dotcom@yahoogroups.com writes:


> trust and faith that you will be provided
> for, call it god, the universe, a higher power, whatever. Oftentimes, you
> have to close a door before another opens up. This topic is very relelvant
> to
> me right now as we may be getting ready to close on of those doors I am
> talking about and take a leap of faith on a new business. It's not that my
> husband is away that much at all but a home business would keep us all
> together so much more.. . . anyway, I need to keep focuesd on trusting . .
> .
>
> lovemary
>

Good luck with your new business.... Ultimately Steve will have his own
business where he works part time and I work part time. That way we can both
be with them. I did have to take a leap of faith. The other alternative was
to wait for the "safe" thing to happen. Sometimes I have had to create that
space to allow the good things to come along. At the beginning of the week
after writing about 7 preschools that my son had been too, the light bulb
went back on that he isn't meant to go there and to just jump in and do this.
We unschooled for 6 months last year, but I think I did it half heartedly
and hadn't completely changed my priorities. This time I scaled back my
business to only weekends (apart from the radio shows which are usually at
5am in the morning, when kidlets are asleep) and started to look at the
lifestyle hubby and I want to have and how we can craft businesses around
that.

It still takes faith and it sounds like that's what you have right now...
Good luck with your venture. By the way, what is it? Tell everyone what you
are doing because you never know who might need your services and where you
are going to meet those people.

Dawn
